bug.author: MichaelDoron
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
The transform function in the Interval constraint class allows tensors to be above the upper bound. <denchmark-h:h2>To reproduce</denchmark-h>
** Code snippet to reproduce ** import torch import gpytorch lower_bound = 0.2 upper_bound = 0.3 tensor = torch.Tensor([lower_bound + upper_bound + 0.1]) constrained_tensor = gpytorch.constraints.Interval(lower_bound = lower_bound, upper_bound=upper_bound).transform(tensor) assert constrained_tensor >= lower_bound, 'constrained tensor smaller than lower bound' assert constrained_tensor <= upper_bound, 'constrained tensor larger than upper bound' ** Stack trace/error message ** AssertionError: constrained tensor larger than upper bound <denchmark-h:h2>Expected Behavior</denchmark-h>
We would want the constrained tensor to be between lower bound and upper bound <denchmark-h:h2>System information</denchmark-h>
Please complete the following information:
0.3.2
1.1.0
macOS
